meanings.definition: Represent (something) as being larger, greater, better, or worse than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: She always exaggerates her accomplishments to impress others.
meanings.sent2: He often exaggerates the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent3: The way he exaggerates his height makes me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter exaggerates the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes exaggerate the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: Overstate or magnify (something) beyond the limits of truth.
meanings.sent1: The news report exaggerates the severity of the storm.
meanings.sent2: Don't exaggerate the cost of the repairs; it's not that expensive.
meanings.sent3: His storytelling always exaggerates the details for dramatic effect.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises exaggerate the changes he can make.
meanings.sent5: The mirror exaggerates the size of the room, making it appear larger than it is.
